snippet: Relatives of the victims of Mexico’s violence must also grapple with suspicions about involvement in the drug trade from friends and family.
abstract: Family of Alfredo Carrillo, who was killed in 2011, is emblematic of the experience of families and relatives grieving over the loss of loved ones as a result of Mexico's drug wars; many are also grappling with suspicions of those who wonder if the victims were asking for trouble and if their relatives might be outlaws, too.
lead_paragraph: Relatives of the victims of Mexico’s violence must also grapple with suspicions about involvement in the drug trade from friends and family.

headline.seo: Doubts and Suspicion Haunt Victims’ Relatives in Mexico
headline.main: Mexican Violence Leaves Behind Trail of Doubts
headline.print_headline: Mexican Violence Leaves Behind Trail of Doubts
